title: Evaluation of Developmental Toxicity, Developmental Neurotoxicity, and Tissue Dose in Zebrafish Exposed to GenX and Other PFAS

This indicates that these emerging fluoroether PFAS, including GenX, have safety advantages over PFHxS and can be interpreted as safer alternatives.

title: Adverse PFAS effects on mouse oocyte in vitro maturation are associated with carbon‐chain length and inclusion of a sulfonate group
reasoning: The abstract compares the toxicity of different PFAS compounds, specifically noting that perfluorobutanesulfonic acid (PFBS) and all perfluoroalkyl carboxylic acids (PFCA) did not show similar adverse cytotoxicity as perfluorohexanesulfonic acid (PFHxS) and perfluorooctanesulfonic acid (PFOS). This indicates that PFBS and PFCA have lower reproductive toxicity and thus can be interpreted as safer alternatives to PFHxS.

target_chemical_harm.rationale: The reasoning text explicitly states that PFAS, including perfluorohexanesulfonic acid (PFHxS), are persistent and bioaccumulative.
